page.title: 19A DESCRIPTION OF OUR D-BLOCK
page.content: The Colne Valley got it's name from the River Colne which runs through it. A main road,a canal,and a railway line also run through the area. The railway station is just a wooden platform with a small shelter on it.In Slaithwaite there are quite a few shops.The houses are built out of different materials,some are local stone and slate roofs others are built of bricks and tiles.Because the area is a steep sided valley most of the houses are built in the valley bottom, although some are built on the sides. Slaithwaite is in the parish of St. James.The biggest school in the area is the Colne Valley High School,which has about 1800 pupils aged 11-18.This school has about 20 feeder primary schools,which means that they are quite small.On the hillside are several chapels.{ Catherine Lawson.
